intro: Neltuma pallescens, commonly known as the pale neltuma, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pale green leaves that are often covered in a fine, silky hair. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in clusters, contributing to its subtle aesthetic. Neltuma pallescens is adapted to high-altitude environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions with well-drained soil.
